title: Data Architect
desc:
Job description
                    
We’re looking for an experienced Data Architect to join our team. We are looking for someone who has a strong cloud technology experience to help our big data team to take our products to the next level.
This is a hands-on role - you will be required to architect, design and build our big data pipelines. You are expected to bring with you extensive hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services (Kinesis streams, EMR, Redshift), Spark and other Big Data processing frameworks and technologies as well as advanced knowledge of RDBS and Data Warehousing solutions.
Requirements:
A degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
5+ years of experience
Extensive experience in AWS, certification will be a bonus.
You have in-depth knowledge of data architecture data modelling and database design best practice.
In depth knowledge of both OLAP and OLTP systems.
Hands on experience in big data migrations and data warehousing.
Knowledge of data governance and data quality strategies.
Understanding of a range of database technologies, including relational and NoSQL
Ability to write code in python.

title: Sr. Software Engineer |Big Data
desc:
Job description
                    
As Time Inc. continues to invest in streamlining their business and improving our software practices and efficiencies across all of our brands, we are seeking a capable and talented Sr. Software Engineer to help define and build Time Inc.'s next-generation data platform. This individual will participate in the ideation of and delivery of key aspects of our new architecture ranging from data ingestion, consumer behavioral insights, machine learning, data governance and customer privacy. The scope of this role is all aspects of data management for Time Inc. and its brands.
This role will involve software development of key data platform modules for Time Inc.'s next-generation data platform ecosystem. Responsibilities for engineering will span all aspects of data, including but not limited to: data ingestion, governance, machine learning, analytics and insights and personalization systems. You will contribute to the ecosystem's design and architecture, and be responsible for detailed design of full vertical modules within the data platform. This role involves both coaching/mentoring of other engineers as well as significant hands-on engineering. Strong test-driven development skills and incremental and rapid iteration in your development ethic is critical for this fast-moving and key initiative for Time Inc. Proven track-record of developing large-scale systems using service-oriented architecture and cloud technologies is a must as that will be part of your routine role. Our efforts will include both individual system development as well as assessment and integration of third-party software products. Knowledge and experience utilizing standardized APIs and specifications are preferred.  Knowledge in the data space around data management, ingestion, and learning is a must. Experience with data related cloud technologies such as AWS Redshift, S3, Kinesis, Lambda, RDS, Aurora, EMR are strongly desired as well as experience with data science technologies such as neo4j and R.
Experience and Requirements
Master's Degree in Computer Science or related field with 1+ year relevant experience; or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field with 5+ years relevant experience
Demonstrated proficiency with Java, C++, or equivalent object-oriented programming language; or demonstrated ability to quickly learn new programming languages and tools
Experience working in Python, NodeJS or similar Lambda-supported languages
Object-oriented analysis and design skills
Problem solving and analytical abilities
Understanding of algorithmic design and complexity analysis
Strong verbal and written communication skills and an ability to work in a team environment
Experience building high-performance, highly-available, and scalable distributed systems
Proven ability to identify and mitigate the root cause of issues
Demonstrated skill and passion for operational excellence
Experience collecting software product requirements, describing software product features, and creating technical designs
Experience with cloud-based technologies and Software-as-a-Service (Saas) systems such as Amazon AWS.
Experience with service-oriented architectures
Ideal Additional Qualifications
Experience with AWS Kinesis, Data Migration Service, Data Pipeline, SQS and other data movement technologies is a plus.
Experience with Oozie, Sqoop, Flume, Falcon, Kafka, Storm, Spark and/or other Hadoop Ecosystem components are a plus.
Experience in ETL/ELT workflow management is a plus.
Experience with Big Data database components such as Hive, AWS Redshift, and/or AWS DynamoDB is a plus.

title: Engineering Manager,  Python
desc:
Job description
                    
iHeartRadio is looking for a hands-on software development manager to join our content and publication engineering team. The team processes, enriches, transcodes, curates and ultimately publishes millions of songs, videos, and podcasts to our iHeartRadio applications. We ingest hundreds of thousands of tracks monthly for a catalog of over 40 million media products. The team plays a vital role in building and supporting our core content and media platform which supports the foundation of our product and features.
If you are interested in managing a team of engineers in a fast-paced agile environment, building amazing products, and reaching tens of millions of users, this is a great place to be. You would be interacting with key stakeholders and work closely with teams such as Data Science, Data Platform, Content Operations as well as the Backend API team. We are highly focused on using the right tools for the job, building decoupled flexible architectures, and giving ownership and responsibility to autonomous teams.
Responsibilities:
Manage a team of engineers who design, develop, test, and deploy scalable media ingestion and real time publication services for music, video, and other content.
Build our next generation multi-tenant Content/Publication platform supporting new products and features.
Facilitate cross team collaboration with software engineering, data engineering, content management, operations and product teams.
Cultivate team members’ career goals and personal growth initiatives.
Represent and communicate team capabilities and engineering priorities across the organization.
Contribute to the codebase, architect and design new systems and participate in code review.
Qualifications:
Experience managing or leading small to medium sized engineering teams in a dynamic environment.
Strong fundamentals with decoupled message based systems and supporting tools development.
Proven track record facilitating and realizing product goals through effective communication across an organization.
Experience in continuous deployment and testing.
Knowledge of algorithms and data structures and how to apply them when designing and building systems.
Solid experience in Python and at least one other programming language.
Experience with SQL/NOSQL systems such as MongoDB, Cassandra, Postgres, etc.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
iHeartMedia is an equal opportunity employer and will not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected classification or status.

title: Director, Data Engineering
desc:
Job description
                    
Position Overview:
iHeartMedia has data problems, both big and small. This means managing extensive listening history from over 100 million users, music metadata on over 30 million tracks, data processing for 850+ broadcast stations, ad sales/impressions, subscription events, and targeted advertising campaigns. The Director who joins our team will impact how people listen to the radio, how the marketing and advertising industry can connect with our millions of listeners, retention/acquisition, and help drive important business decisions with a robust data platform.
We are looking for someone passionate about data to help define our data strategies, grow our capabilities, and build our platform team. The person in this role will be focused on developing the foundations for critical data products, including real time business metrics and analytics capabilities. The role requires managing a team vital in supporting and collaborating with groups including Data Science, Analytics/BI/Product, as well as our core backend API team.  We are highly focused on giving ownership and responsibility to autonomous teams, using the right tools for the job, and building flexible architectures.
 Responsibilities:
Provide day-to-day work management, technical guidance, strategic direction, problem resolution, and career path development for Data Engineering team.
Architect, design and implement scalable ETL and data processing systems to handle the big data ecosystem including data collection, processing, ETL and DWH.
Build real time capabilities and insight into product metrics to help product managers and BI/Analytics understand and optimize product features and guide product decisions.
Build internal Reporting and Analytics platform on top of our Big Data Lake.
Represent and communicate team capabilities and engineering priorities across the organization.
Contribute to the codebase, architect and design new systems, and participate in code review.
Manage data infrastructure, and strategic decisions, to grow and support the team as well as the organization as it relates to Data Platform.
Requirements:
Experience managing or leading small to medium sized engineering teams in a dynamic environment
Solid engineering background and understanding of programming languages such as Python, Java, Scala or equivalent
Strong understanding of SQL, experience with key databases such as Oracle, Vertica, Redshift, etc.
Deep knowledge of the Hadoop and the surrounding ecosystem.
Solid understanding of real time and batch data processing framework such as Hadoop, Spark, Flink, etc.
Proven track record facilitating and realizing product goals through effective communication across an organization.
Experience in continuous deployment and testing.
Experience with SQL/NOSQL systems such as MongoDB, Cassandra, Postgres, etc.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
iHeartMedia is an equal opportunity employer and will not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other legally-protected status.

title: Scala / Python Data Engineer M/F - Smart mobility to experience the world
desc:
Job description
                    
Who we are
FlixBus is a European long distance mobility provider and a brand of the FlixMobility group. Since 2013, FlixBuses have offered a new, convenient and green way to travel which suits every budget. Thanks to a smart business model and an innovative technology, the former startup has established Europe's largest intercity bus network in less than four years. We want to grow our successful German business and therefore we are looking for Data Engineers (m/f) to join our Data Science team based in Berlin, Germany.
Your tasks
You will be responsible for building a data platform that manages our companies' data flows. The platform consists of several services (messaging, streaming, persistence, machine learning etc.) that can be used by our product development teams in a self-service way. As a member of one of our product development teams, you will be building data-intensive applications on top of our data platform, ranging from data ingestion to processing and making use of the data to provide smart services to our customers and internal business users.
Your Profile
3+ years of experience as Data Engineer or Software EngineerSolid expertise in at least one programming language (preferably Scala, Java or Python) Working experience with structured engineering methods like test first (TDD, BDD)Experience with big data technologies (Flume, Kafka, Spark, Hadoop, Redshift and NoSQL Databases) Practical experience with Amazon Web Services Nice to have: Previous experience in the design and implementation of complex data pipelines (AWS Data Pipeline) Familiarity with machine learning, real-time data processing, data warehousing and data visualization techniquesExperience with Docker
Our offer
Environment: - Be part of an incredibly fast growing company with a strong brand and highly motivated and international team - Work on your self-defined challenges during our HackRday once a month! - Cutting edge technologies, Agile development practices, and product focused environment dealing with demanding engineering and scaling challenges - Training and Conference opportunities - Office location in the heart of Berlin or Munich- Flexible working hours Benefits: - Language course support - Relocation support - Competitive salary

title: Senior Software Engineer
desc:
Job description
                    
Senior Software Engineer
Looking for Fullstack, Frontend, and/or Backend
Champaign, Illinois


Agriculture is not the same as it was twenty years ago, and it won’t be the same twenty years from now. Climate conditions are changing. The world needs more food from the same arable land. Consumer preferences and regulations are evolving. Public expectations are rising and accountability matters more. And farmers need to respond to these changing dynamics - they are at the core of our food system and our planet.Granular creates Farm Management Software and land valuation software, AcreValue, that empowers farms to become more valuable businesses, for today and for the future. We take a user-centric development and design approach to develop products that are simple to use that our farmers love! 
We are looking for a Senior Fullstack Engineer to join our team full time in Champaign, IL.  You will have the opportunity to be a part of a top San Francisco company while enjoying the benefits of living in the Midwest.
WHAT YOU'LL BE WORKING ON
Work closely with other developers, product managers, data science and design to develop a high-performance, scalable web application for enterprise use.
Create new and/or optimize existing application pages to be responsive, amazingly fast, and easy-to-maintain by other engineers.
Work with raw data for business analytics/data warehousing (of growing size) and present in a user-friendly way for farmers to understand their fields.
Designing and building an application our farmers can use in the office and in the field.
Create an application that aggregates and analyzes terabytes of data about soils, climate, crop rotations, taxes, interest rates, and corn prices to calculate the estimated value of an individual field.
Work directly with the product and design team to create a compelling user experience that is easy to use, and fast to implement.
Build a workflow that is simple for our farmers to use, yet captures the complexity of managing a professional farm.
Scale the product and team. There is a need, and flexibility for, horizontal and upward mobility.
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
No farming/agriculture knowledge required!
7+ years of experience developing user-friendly web applications in a fast-paced environment
Strong sense for high-quality user experience.
Significant experience with a variety of modern web application technologies.
Specific experience with or desire to learn technologies including Javascript (including AngularJS), HTML/CSS, Python (including Pyramid, Django), MongoDB and PostgreSQL
Experience building scalable web applications
Knowledge and experience with DevOps, monitoring, continuous integration, etc. a plus.
Excellent software design skills, code quality and attention to detail.
Background in analysis and visualization of geospatial data a plus.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
The passion for revolutionizing the agriculture industry with your hard earned engineering skills!
B.S. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or other technical degree and/or equivalent experience.
PERKS
At Granular, perks are more than free lunches and happy hour (which we have).  We offer a team where you can grow, a professional development path, respect for life outside of work and a stipend for educational conferences.
Enjoy frequent trips to our headquarters in San Francisco.
Upward movement.  We are growing quickly and need talent who can take on increasingly challenging and rewarding roles.
We value diversity and treat every employee with a high degree of autonomy and respect.
Have a big impact by joining a small, fast-paced, smart team. We are having fun building a great company and helping one of the most important industries in the world.
Competitive salary, commission program, and stock options.
Medical, dental, vision and 401(K) benefits.

title: Software Engineer | AI Startup
industry: Artificial Intelligence, Enterprise Software, Machine Learning
desc:
Job description
                    
At HyperScience we bring AI to the enterprise. Our products help enterprises and government institutions function by automating certain kinds of office work and reducing bureaucratic burden both on businesses and their customers. We take a heterogeneous approach to AI, using a blend of what are traditionally considered different fields of ML: deep learning, computer vision, and NLP among others. We believe that AI is destined to be the biggest event in the history of human labor since the Industrial Revolution, and we want to be a part of it. Our software engineering team is small, scrappy, and collaborative. We’re looking for talented engineers of all backgrounds and experience levels who embody the team’s values -- quick learners who can dive into the weeds of complex technical problems, see the big picture, and take ownership of projects.
Your responsibilities:
End-to-end product development: from idea generation to shipping, testing and everything in between
Build the infrastructure around our ML models
Desired qualifications:
BA/BS in a relevant field (CS, engineering, etc) or equivalent hands-on experience
Problem-solver with the ability to pivot from one project to the next quickly and seamlessly
Desire to carve out your own role in a fast-moving, agile environment
Team player with strong communication skills
Preferred qualifications (the nice-to-have's):
Experience with one or more general purpose languages (Java, C/C++, Python, etc)
Experience with database systems such as SQL and NoSQL solutions
Strong algorithmic knowledge and/or experience with distributed systems
Demonstrated passion for ML and/or data science
We’re a small team that’s passionate about ML work -- we all jump in to create datasets, optimize ML models and measure accuracy improvements. HyperScience provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HyperScience complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Ruby) : Monolith ---> Microservices
desc:
Job description
                    
Our team is collaborating on solving some complex development tasks that result from our continually increasing numbers of sellers and buyers (14 million monthly visitors and rising!). We’ve already implemented localisations for various European countries and will be expanding even further, outside of Europe, in the near future.
That is why we need your help; we want to expand our team by introducing even more expert knowledge. You will work on challenges around scale, microservice architecture and implementing new features in Product focused innovation teams in which Front-End developers, Back-End developers, a Designer, a Data Scientist, and a Product Owner all work closely together. We are driven by A/B-testing and automated testing, which allows us to do multiple releases per day on our high-traffic website.
You will work with Ruby on Rails, nginx, MySql, Redis, ElasticSearch, Javascript, React, and Git in an agile development team of 60+ developers (and growing). We have headquarters in both Assen and Amsterdam in The Netherlands.
Skills & Requirements
Significant experience in building complex web applications using Rails development.
Excellent problem solving, communication and collaboration skills.
Experience with relational databases (MySQL)
Worked on high-traffic websites (preferred)
Experience with A/B-testing and conversion optimisation (preferred)

title: Senior Python Engineer (Backend / Data Driven/ Zalon)
desc:
Job description
                    
Zalon is the successful story of curating and delivering complete outfits for our customers. Part of Europe's Leading Technology Fashion Platform, we live and breathe excellent software engineering.As part of our recruitment ramp-up for a designated Data Science & Research Engineering team, you, as a Python Backend Engineer will bring the engineering perspective into our products. Expect a role where you will have immediate impact as we iterate fast and experiment a lot, welcoming your innovative engineering ideas to the table. The teams work with full end-to-end responsibility on solving the challenges at hand - starting with ideating over prototyping and user testing to bringing features live and checking their performance.WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
Python skills (deep understanding of language internals, profiling, best practices, eg. Pandas, Scikit-learn). Java or Scala experience (or an interest) would also be appreciated.
Solid understanding of data structures, coding standards, best practices, software design, architecture.
Interest in setting up monitoring, tracking and reporting, designing and implementing pipelines for training and deploying new models and a real curiosity around "how algorithms work".
Familiarity with RESTful APIs, particularly using cloud infrastructure such as AWS. Knowledge of microservice architecture and distributed systems is also advantageous.
At least 3 years of professional programming experience in a commercial environment, backed-up by a Masters or Bachelor Degree in a relevant subject or additional working experience.
English language fluency
YOUR ROLE
You will communicate with the data scientists (or machine learning experts or research engineers) and exchange ideas about solutions to the existent and potential problems. You will do this by identifying the right components and putting them together in the correct manner.
You will work closely with product owners and the business counterparts, acting as a sparring partner on technical solutions to our immediate challenges.
You will be part of a team where Code Quality, Code Reviews, Test Coverage, etc. are kept at very high standards, therefore you should also be positive and firm in your attitude towards them.
You design, develop, deploy, operate and improve important software solutions, that your peers praise for its elegance and code readability.
You will be accountable for all aspects of your work as you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).
You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from ideation over design to implementation and maintenance.
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US
Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, Hack weeks, parties and events.
Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.
Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at related Conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish your work.
Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours. Zalon is a 2.5-year-old start-up backed up by Zalando SE, therefore you can expect that your work will have immediate impact and you will participate in developing significant improvements.

title: Software Innovator (IoT, Node.js, Spark)
desc:
Job description
                    
At R3PI, Solera’s R&D Team, we are a group of dedicated and disruptive innovators who are committed to building the future of Solera. We wake up every day hating what we did yesterday, so that we can do it different today and change the world around us. We operate like a greenfield startup environment and build our software incrementally, iteratively, and continuously (agile, kanban). Our playground consists of connected car, mobile apps, 3D, AR, image analytics, data science and things that don’t even exist... yet.
We pride ourselves on being uncommon. We seek individuals who are prepared to push and challenge themselves each day to do it right, better and different. You want to work in a collaborative team environment where accountability is demanding and rewarding.
We are seeking high-energy, versatile, and uncommon innovators who possess both the development skills and business acumen to operate at a hyper-fast and accurate speed. Our rapid innovation team is responsible for using the latest, cutting edge technologies to combine any and all global data, software, and services to create innovative concepts and solutions that will help our customers gain a competitive edge in the digital world.
How You'd Kick Ass:
Full Stack Development. You will be involved with server-side & client-side software development using the best tool for the job, whether it's Scala/Spark, Node.js, Swift, or even C++ to drive rapid innovation of Solera's products. You will write well designed, testable, efficient code to design and develop rapid prototypes and high-volume, low-latency applications, delivering high-availability and performance.
Cross-Functional and Able to Tackle Any Environment. You are an expert when it comes to software design, development standardization, and componentization/modularization. You are able to jump into other architectural roles where needed. You don't fit a cookie-cutter, job description – your diverse background and deep understanding of engineering fundamentals & best practices allow you to contribute to the team by any means necessary.
Passion for IoT & Utilizing Cutting-Edge Technology. You have a passion for Connected Home and IoT with a talent for 
Requirements:
4+ years of experience in a similar technology development environment
Strong Experience with Scala / Java
Strong Experience with Node.js 
Exposure to working in an agile environment
Experience with microservices architecture
Experience with Spark / Hadoop preferred
Strong Experience with both statically & dynamically typed languages
Proven track record of developing enterprise class REST web services
Experience with React.js and/or AngularJS
Experience with AWS
Experience with NoSQL databases
Experience with Native Mobile Development (Swift, Android) is a plus
Experience working with IoT applications is a plus
Experience building B2B and B2C solutions is a plus
Experience with Unity3D is a plus
Experience developing augmented reality applications is a plus
OpenHAB, Lutron, Control4, Just Add Power, SmartThings and other Connected Home technologies is a plus
Experience with Lambda, and Alexa Skills Set is a plus
Benefits:
Startup-like environment, international team collaborating across Zurich, Dallas, London
No MBA or academic egos; this is a meritocracy where you prove your worth by doing cool stuff -daily
Work with leading technologists of their fields, opportunities to learn and grow every day
Access to the tools and technologies you choose to get the job done
Cool office located next to Bellevue at Lake Zurich: a former garage including gym, shower, foosball, free drinks and snacks…

title: Senior Python Engineer
industry: Data & Analytics, Speech Recognition, Speech Analytics
desc:
Job description
                    
What are we building?
Speech recognition, natural language processing, and predictive analytics at cloud scale
Highly scalable, distributed microservices that run across 10,000 CPU cores in an architecture designed for 1 billion minutes per month
A seamless developer experience and showcase UX for voice/speech analytics applications
What will you be working on?
The VoiceBase platform extensively uses the Python data science and Machine Learning stack (Matplotlib, numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, Anaconda, Jupyter) for analytical heavy-lifting. You will work on the platform team, and partner with our data science team, to make our Machine Learning and analytics resilient, fault-tolerant, and fully production-grade.
Who are you?
An experienced Python engineer who loves to code and has a passion for analytics and machine learning.
What will your responsibilities be?
Creating robust analytical services
Using modern machine learning libraries for technical and scientific computing
Writing code, unit testing, packaging, and deploying
Working with peers who provide direct and open design feedback
Getting your work in production and into customers' hands... every two weeks
What makes you qualified?
Ability to write clear, resilient, production-ready Python code
Firm grasp of best practices in Python2 and Python3
Exposure to modern machine libraries, like Matplotlib, Numpy, and Scipy
Experience with text processing, NLP, and/or search
Leadership skills

title: FBI Special Agent - STEM Careers
desc:
Job description
                    
Use your technology expertise in a career like no other! As an FBI Special Agent, you will bring your skills, talents and integrity to a dedicated team working at the highest level to get ahead of threats, protect the American people and uphold the Constitution of the United States.
A “routine” day may include interviewing a subject for an ongoing investigation in the morning, testifying in court about a computer breach before lunch, planning an operation in the afternoon and speaking about cyber threats at a community event in the evening. You may participate in arrests or raids, and execute search warrants and other dangerous assignments. You must maintain a high level of physical fitness, think on your feet, and be able to effectively respond to life-threatening situations. In an organization made up of careers like no other, being a Special Agent can be a lifelong career of uncommon days and amazing experiences — as part of a mission-focused family that is One FBI.
Special Agents are responsible for enforcing more than 300 federal statutes, as well as conducting sensitive national security investigations. You’ll work to develop relationships within and across communities and educate fellow law enforcement and national security partners at local, state, federal, and international levels, all to support our mission: To protect the American people and uphold the Constitution of the United States.
DUTIES
You are a problem solver with great analytical skills and leadership experience; you know how to get things done both in a demanding team environment and independently. Your ability to adapt to changing situations and clearly communicate across management, peer groups, external communities and stakeholders contributes to your ability to keep our nation safe. You’re naturally curious and always driven to find a solution. You notice minute details, yet remain strategic. You objectively evaluate information and make sound judgments. Honesty and integrity are more than just words to you — they are the foundation of who you are. You take pride in making a difference in the communities you serve, and bringing your background and unique skills to initiatives that impact our most important stakeholders: the American people.
In this role, you’ll be expected to use both established and innovative approaches to tackle some of the toughest challenges of our age. This opportunity should not be taken lightly. The FBI Special Agent position requires significant commitment and dedication from you and your family, but you’ll go home every night knowing you’re making a difference. Being an FBI Special Agent is an experience you'll never forget.
Though individuals of all backgrounds are highly encouraged to apply, we’re specifically seeking the following skills:
SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING AND MATH (STEM): Accounting, forensic science, computer technology, cyber security, electronics, economics, finance, biometrics, encryption, data science, information technology, mathematics, chemistry, computer forensics, biology, and more. When people say STEM, you perk up because you know they are talking about you.
FOREIGN LANGUAGES: You may have been raised speaking a language other than English, taught it for a few years or even participated in intensive learning before going overseas to use it. You know that your language skills can make a difference: Arabic, Yoruba, Mandarin, Tagalog, Russian, Spanish, Farsi, Punjabi, Pashtu, Urdu and more.
Skills & Requirements
KEY REQUIREMENTS
Minimum Qualifications: 
Must be at least age 23 and not yet 37 at the time of your appointment. (Age waivers are available.)
Must be able to obtain a Top Secret Clearance.
Must possess a valid driver's license.
Must meet the FBI’s physical fitness requirements.
Must commit to serving as a Special Agent for a minimum of three (3) years.
Work Experience: All Special Agent applicants must also have at least three (3) years of full-time professional work experience unless they qualify for a waiver. Work experience showing progressive growth, leadership and responsibility is preferred. Certain specified experiences and/or abilities waive the three-year full-time work experience requirement. These include applicants with degrees in Computer Science, Information Technology, a Juris Doctorate (J.D.) degree and Certified Public Accountants (CPAs). Applicants with masters’ and/or doctorate degrees require two (2) years of full-time work experience. NOTE: Meeting the requirements for a waiver does not guarantee that you will be deemed "Most Competitive."
Physical Requirements: Applicants must pass FBI Special Agent Physical Requirements, including medical and hearing standards. Applicants must also pass the Physical Fitness Test (PFT) and be physically fit to complete a Basic Field Training Course at Quantico and effectively respond to life-threatening situations in the field.
For more information about the Special Agent Selection System (SASS) physical fitness requirements and work experience waivers, please visit https://fbijobs.gov/career-paths/special-agents.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EVALUATIONS
Special Agent candidates must go through an extensive testing and interview process. Learn more about this on www.fbijobs.gov.
AUTOMATIC DISQUALIFIERS
Applicants convicted of a felony, who use illegal drugs in violation of the FBI Employment Drug Policy, who are in default of a student loan insured by the U.S. Government, who fail an FBI urinalysis drug test or who fail to register with the Selective Service System (males only) are not eligible for employment with the FBI.
Applicants should consider that the average processing time to complete all stages of the selection process may take approximately one (1) year. The FBI may disqualify applicants at any time during the process, should it be determined that they will reach age 37 before appointment to the Basic Field Training Course.
SECURITY
Must be able to obtain a Top Secret Clearance.
HOW TO APPLY
When submitting applications, please follow the Federal Resume Template available at www.fbijobs.gov under the “Documents for Application” tab. This page also gives many details about the application process.    
Learn more about the special agent career, fitness requirements, and the Physical Fitness Test (PFT) here.
Learn more about the job posting on apply.fbijobs.gov.
Equal Employment Opportunity 
The FBI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer; our employees come from diverse backgrounds but share a common mission that makes us One FBI — and all qualified applicants will receive consideration. Except where otherwise provided by law, selection will be made without regard to, and with no discrimination based on color, race, religion, national origin, political affiliation, marital status, parental status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, age, sex, sexual orientation, membership or non-membership in an employee organization, personal favoritism or any other non-merit factors.

title: AWS, Dev Ops Engineer, Analytics
desc:
Job description
                    
The Analytics Office at Financial Engines seeks an experienced Dev Ops engineer to build and maintain a robust AWS cloud infrastructure to support our data warehouse and data pipelines, business intelligence assets, and data science capabilities. 
What is the Analytics Office?
The Analytics Office is three groups within the Investment Management department of Financial Engines:  Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, and Financial Technology.  We own analytics systems like the data warehouse, Tableau dashboards, certain corporate data marts, and the data pipelines that feed them.  We are separate from the product development and IT departments that own our corporate product code and production systems.  The expectation of the company is for Analytics to be largely self-sufficient in its systems and administration.  As opposed to the product organization (Java), Analytics is primarily a Python shop.
Responsibilities and Roles
Develop and maintain an AWS code deployment pipeline for the Analytics Office
Deploy and administer systems to perform such tasks as scheduling, access management, resource scaling and orchestration
Deploy and administer systems for production support of Analytics Office production environments
Experience transitioning from an on premise to cloud based architecture
Write infrastructure as code with Cloud Formation and/or Teraform
Support Analytics assets such as dashboards and machine-learning processes in AWS
Help develop AWS POCs
Provide subject matter expertise on DevOps principles
Knowledge in running business intelligence and analytics applications within AWS
Qualifications:
BS or MS in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar 
Experience as DevOps engineer in a scalable production environment (4+ years)
Knowledge of Linux systems administration and architecture (2+ years)
Proficient working with Amazon Web Services (AWS) like EC2, EBS, ELB, S3, and Cloudfront in a highly available and scalable production environment (3+ years)
Experience developing and maintaining infrastructure-as-code with Cloud Formation or Terraform (2+ years)
Experience with Python and shell scripting (3+)
Experience with configuration management using such tools as Ansible (preferred), Puppet, Salt,or Chef. (4+ years)
Experience with Jenkins or other CICD scheduler (1-2+ years)
AWS certification (DevOps, SysOps, Cloud Architect) a plus.

title: Software Architect | Big Data
desc:
Job description
                    
As Time Inc. continues to invest in streamlining their business and improving our software practices and efficiencies across all of our brands, we are seeking a capable and talented Software Architect to help define and build Time Inc.'s next-generation data platform. This individual will participate in the ideation of and delivery of key aspects of our new architecture ranging from data ingestion, consumer behavioral insights, machine learning, data governance and customer privacy. The scope of this role is all aspects of data management for Time Inc. and its brands.
This role will involve software development of key data platform modules for Time Inc.'s next-generation data platform ecosystem. Responsibilities for engineering will span all aspects of data, including but not limited to: data ingestion, governance, machine learning, analytics and insights and personalization systems. You will contribute to the ecosystem's design and architecture, and be responsible for detailed design of full vertical modules within the data platform. This role involves both coaching/mentoring of other engineers as well as significant hands-on engineering. Strong test-driven development skills and incremental and rapid iteration in your development ethic is critical for this fast-moving and key initiative for Time Inc. Proven track-record of developing large-scale systems using service-oriented architecture and cloud technologies is a must as that will be part of your routine role. Our efforts will include both individual system development as well as assessment and integration of third-party software products. Knowledge and experience utilizing standardized APIs and specifications are preferred.  Knowledge in the data space around data management, ingestion, and learning is a must. Experience with data related cloud technologies such as AWS Redshift, S3, Kinesis, Lambda, RDS, Aurora, EMR are strongly desired as well as experience with data science technologies such as neo4j and R.
Experience and Requirements
Master's or higher degree in Computer Science or similar technical field
10+ years in software development using Java or equivalent development languages
5+ years in technical leadership experience, demonstrating increasing impact and sphere of influence
Experience building and operating large scale, distributed, service oriented systems
Experience building and operating high volume consumer-facing software products
Experience in designing and defining APIs and services used by developers
Expert systems design and coding skills
Proven ability to deliver reliable, maintainable and performant software solutions
Strong data analysis and debugging skills
Experience working with data storage and/or management platforms as well as machine learning preferred.
Experience working in Python, NodeJS or similar Lambda-supported languages
Ideal Additional Qualifications
Experience with AWS Kinesis, Data Migration Service, Data Pipeline, SQS and other data movement technologies is a plus.
Experience with Oozie, Sqoop, Flume, Falcon, Kafka, Storm, Spark and/or other Hadoop Ecosystem components are a plus.
Experience working in serverless environments such as AWS Lambda
Experience in ETL/ELT workflow management is a plus.
Experience with Big Data database components such as Hive, AWS Redshift, and/or AWS DynamoDB is a plus.

title: Sr Big Data Developer (Hadoop)
desc:
Job description
                    
This is a senior level IT position on the Big Data/Hadoop team. Responsibilities include building Hadoop based applications as well as mentoring junior developers on a wide variety of Hadoop and related technologies. This position will be responsible for leading development teams on building batch and real time/streaming applications leveraging diverse data sets on Hadoop that feed predictive models and other analytical use cases that are integrated via web services with internal and customer facing systems. This position will be expected to provide technical guidance and hands on mentoring of junior developers across a broad spectrum of Hadoop and Big Data related technologies. 
Skills & Requirements
• Hands on senior level experience developing applications and mentoring other onshore and offshore junior developers on a wide variety of Hadoop and related technologies which must include Sqoop, Hive, Pig, Spark, Spark Streaming, Kafka, Hbase, Solr. (Experience with Apache NiFi is a plus)
• Demonstrated experience and mentoring of junior level developers on Data Warehousing projects leveraging the Hadoop platform for ingesting, integrating, and delivering large and diverse data sets (such as Mainframe, RDBMS, text files, images, call recordings, unstructured text, PDFs, sensor data, web activity) for various analytical use cases required.
• Demonstrated experience and mentoring of junior Hadoop developers working with Data Science teams to enable development and deployment of predictive models leveraging various technologies on the Hadoop platform such as R, Python, Spark, H20, SAS etc. strongly desired. Extensive experience with statistics is not required, however this individual will work closely with data scientists and statisticians providing IT support for deployment of data science and predictive applications.
• Demonstrated experience integrating results of Hadoop based analytical applications with other internal and consumer facing systems through Java based Web Services, APIs, or other methods strongly desired.

title: Backend Product Engineer, Python
industry: Data & Analytics, Financial Technology, Geographic Information System
desc:
Job description
                    
At TellusLabs, our goal is to provide insights from satellite imagery that will help solve the biggest problems facing society. How will we feed a rapidly growing global population? How will we manage our increasingly limited water resources? How can we best manage our land and forest resources in an era of climate change? The answers to these pressing questions can be obtained through the innovative use of satellite imagery and Earth data, and the private sector has to be part of the solution. We aim to be a big part of that story. TellusLabs thrives thanks to an interdisciplinary approach that combines, machine learning, statistics, remote sensing, and geospatial sciences. We are always looking for people who share our curiosity and our conviction.
As a Software Engineer at TellusLabs, you will be responsible for creating a platform for transforming massive amounts of data from satellites above the earth and sources on the ground into usable, operational insights for solving real-world problems.  We are building a data platform that unlocks the power of satellite imagery for our data science team, and a machine learning platform that allows us to quickly build powerful models based on our experience creating scientifically meaningful features from that data.  You will be responsible for building and extending the API that our clients use to access data and insights, and that powers Kernel, our web framework that presents the output of our best-in-class crop forecasting models alongside contextual insights and data visualization.
We're looking for:
Excellent python skills & real world experience building production quality, testable, deployable software
Experience with working with SQL (esp. postgres)
Experience building APIs and API design (esp. w/ flask)
Experience with deploying software on AWS
It's a bonus if you have experience with or interest in:
JavaScript & vue.js (our front-end stack)
Geospatial datasets or GIS systems
Data visualization
Swagger/OpenAPI specification
Machine learning & statistics
Cloud DevOps (AWS)
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Software Engineer
desc:
Job description
                    
Engineering at Klaviyo

Klaviyo is a Boston startup located right in the heart of downtown Boston.  We craft software helping thousands of ecommerce companies to have engaging relationships with hundreds of millions of consumers.  We love tackling tough engineering problems and look for full stack engineers who specialize in certain areas but are passionate about building, owning & scaling features end to end from scratch and breaking through any obstacle or technical challenge in their way. We push each other to move out of our comfort zone, learn new technologies and work hard to ensure each day is better than the last.

Klaviyo operates a real-time data platform coded in Python built for massive scale on Amazon Web Services (AWS). Engineers come to Klaviyo with experience in a variety of languages and from a number of disciplines




You Will
Have the chance to wholly own features that thousands of our customers rely on daily to reach 100,000,000+ of consumers to drive their business forward
Work on crafting our highly scalable real-time data pipelinethat processes billions of eventsmonthly across data sets growing to petabyte scale
Be empowered to own the mission, technical direction and operations of projects that have immediate impact
Advance your technical skills in all facets ranging from front end web development and user experience to machine learning and massively parallelized data pipelines.
Contribute to the company as a subject matter expert in multiple areas, constantly pushing yourself to be a better engineer and to level up all of your peers within your team and within Klaviyo
You
Have experience building products that matter and pushing yourself and your team to be better engineers and build a product with passionate advocates
Enjoy working with new technologies ranging from the frontend to backend, and are particularly passionate and an expert in multiple stack areas. You show this by having strong and opinionated experience with various technologies and know how to pick the right tool for any job.
Love digging into performance and scalability issues to drive breakthrough solutions-- whether it's a slow loading UI or too many clicks in a workflow, a database query timing out, or a queue that just won’t drain. You recognize all problems can be solved.
Enjoy shipping code early & often in an agile fashion, pairing with product management to craft better software by soliciting feedback from thousands of end users
Like working on a small, autonomous agile teams. At Klaviyo, you will have ownership of features, but you'll collaborate with everyone to make sure we produce the right solution.
Technologies We Use
Python, Django, Celery
MySQL, Cassandra, RabbitMQ, Redis
HTML, JavaScript, LESS, Backbone.js, React
Amazon Web Services (EC2, RDS, Aurora, etc.)
Problems We're Solving
As a high growth startup we look for candidates that can rise to any occasion and seek out new opportunities to make their mark on our product.  The following are examples of exciting projects the engineering team is working on:
Scaling our data processing systems to handle orders of magnitude more data and perform advanced analytics of billions of events in real time by innovating on event-driven data pipelines and building robust distributed data stores
Overhauling our frontend interfaces to dramatically increase information density and capabilities of our analytics and reporting system. We will enable powerful, expressive and flexible querying of our data sets without compromising the ease of use of the experience
Reliably integrating with 10s of thousands of remote API endpoints to process ecommerce data for historical and real-time syncs
Extracting additional insight from our data sources using machine learning and other data science techniques to allow ecommerce marketers to more efficiently perform their jobs and grow their business, and build features into Klaviyo product to make it incredible easy for marketers to follow best practices

title: Developers for healthcare software platform
desc:
Job description
                    
Note: this job is open to US Residents only.  Foreign nationals can apply but only if you live within the US.
What we do actually matters. CareEvolution's HIEBus platform creates better patient outcomes.
Simply stated, we make web and mobile applications for healthcare. Under the covers, though, a lot more is going on - we have developed a robust software platform that ingresses data, programmatically links that data across institutions on a per-patient basis, and supplies APIs to consume, project, modify, and aggregate that data in all sorts of interesting and useful ways.  Please read our company page for a more detailed explanation of what we do and who we are.
We are looking for software people to help us:
build out our platform
write data adapters (drivers) to automatically ingress data from hundreds of data sources - in realtime
create the next generation of healthcare apps
identify the real needs of our customers, and execute on them accurately, quickly, and professionally
At CareEvolution, we don't tell you what to do. Part of the work at CareEvolution is determining what to do. We've designed our organization specifically to promote creativity, innovation, and focus on solving some of the most difficult problems in healthcare.
Visit http://letsfixhealthcare.com to learn more - or contact us (resume@careevolution.com) - and we'll explain what CareEvolution is all about.
Skills & Requirements
Must haves
A real passion for solving problems in healthcare
High programming expertise
expert knowledge of object-oriented design and design patterns.
Solid relational database chops
A willingness and ability to actively help define the scope of our work
The ability and interest to learn many different things - and teach others
Strategic thinking
In terms of helping us be competitive in the marketplace, yes - but more importantly, strategic in helping us deliver on our mission of creating better patient outcomes.  We're serious about this.
Nice-to-haves
Expertise with one or more of the following
ASP.NET
MVC
MS SQL Server
General (light) DBA-type competencies (rebuilding indexes, etc.)
Debugging queries, diagnostics with execution plans, SQL Profiler, etc.
Python
JS including common frameworks like Angular, React, Ember
Data science/ML
WCF
AWS/EC2
ETL
Lots of experience writing tools and services that process a variety of different data formats; preferably clinical formats, but if you have experience in dealing with lots of different formats and have been in the trenches of gnarly data integration exercises - we're very interested in talking to you.
Clinical IT expertise, including one or more of the following:

HL7
Claims formats
IHE profiles
CCDs
EMRs/EHRs

2+ years of experience writing and maintaining automated UI or end-to-end tests using tools such as Selenium a strong plus
iOS
EC2 configuration and administration
Interest in and ability to interact with clients as design partners
DevOps

title: Sr. Software Engineer | Big Data
desc:
Job description
                    
As Time Inc. continues to invest in streamlining their business and improving our software practices and efficiencies across all of our brands, we are seeking a capable and talented Sr. Software Engineer to help define and build Time Inc.'s next-generation data platform. This individual will participate in the ideation of and delivery of key aspects of our new architecture ranging from data ingestion, consumer behavioral insights, machine learning, data governance and customer privacy. The scope of this role is all aspects of data management for Time Inc. and its brands.
This role will involve software development of key data platform modules for Time Inc.'s next-generation data platform ecosystem. Responsibilities for engineering will span all aspects of data, including but not limited to: data ingestion, governance, machine learning, analytics and insights and personalization systems. You will contribute to the ecosystem's design and architecture, and be responsible for detailed design of full vertical modules within the data platform. This role involves both coaching/mentoring of other engineers as well as significant hands-on engineering. Strong test-driven development skills and incremental and rapid iteration in your development ethic is critical for this fast-moving and key initiative for Time Inc. Proven track-record of developing large-scale systems using service-oriented architecture and cloud technologies is a must as that will be part of your routine role. Our efforts will include both individual system development as well as assessment and integration of third-party software products. Knowledge and experience utilizing standardized APIs and specifications are preferred.  Knowledge in the data space around data management, ingestion, and learning is a must. Experience with data related cloud technologies such as AWS Redshift, S3, Kinesis, Lambda, RDS, Aurora, EMR are strongly desired as well as experience with data science technologies such as neo4j and R.
Experience and Requirements
Master's Degree in Computer Science or related field with 1+ year relevant experience; or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field with 5+ years relevant experience
Demonstrated proficiency with Java, C++, or equivalent object-oriented programming language; or demonstrated ability to quickly learn new programming languages and tools
Experience working in Python, NodeJS or similar Lambda-supported languages
Object-oriented analysis and design skills
Problem solving and analytical abilities
Understanding of algorithmic design and complexity analysis
Strong verbal and written communication skills and an ability to work in a team environment
Experience building high-performance, highly-available, and scalable distributed systems
Proven ability to identify and mitigate the root cause of issues
Demonstrated skill and passion for operational excellence
Experience collecting software product requirements, describing software product features, and creating technical designs
Experience with cloud-based technologies and Software-as-a-Service (Saas) systems such as Amazon AWS.
Experience with service-oriented architectures
Ideal Additional Qualifications
Experience with AWS Kinesis, Data Migration Service, Data Pipeline, SQS and other data movement technologies is a plus.
Experience with Oozie, Sqoop, Flume, Falcon, Kafka, Storm, Spark and/or other Hadoop Ecosystem components are a plus.
Experience in ETL/ELT workflow management is a plus.
Experience with Big Data database components such as Hive, AWS Redshift, and/or AWS DynamoDB is a plus.

title: Senior Data Engineering
desc:
Job description
                    
Revinate is seeking an experienced Data Engineer/ETL specialist to join our data services team. From internal decision-making, to the core services we provide for our customers, data drives our business. As a Senior Data Engineer, you will make an immediate impact on our ability to collect, store, process, and analyze huge sets of data. The ideal candidate is hands-on with significant experience building and maintaining scalable data platforms, data services/APIs, and data science / BI tools.
Our capable and versatile team takes pride in ownership and our engineers are involved right from the start in the architecture and design process. Test-driven development, continuous deployment, pair programming, and a supportive environment are key priorities. Our microservice-based infrastructure includes tools like Docker, Kubernetes, Cassandra, Spark, and Kafka. This means you can design, develop and deploy your own services and create value right away.
We are looking for self-motivated and intelligent individuals who are both skilled collaborators and capable of working independently, who take initiative, and have strong CS fundamentals,.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain a distributed data processing platform
Agile software development using Java 8 or Scala
Collaborate with product managers, data analysts/scientists, engineers, and other business users to understand data needs
Define and manage SLAs for the data platform and its data sets
Qualifications
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science
5+ years experience in data warehousing and ETL pipeline design, implementation, and maintenance
5+ years experience with schema design and dimensional data modeling
Expert knowledge of Java 8 and/or Scala
Familiarity with distributed computing clusters like Spark or Hadoop.
Advanced knowledge of SQL, and experience with NoSQL databases, such as Cassandra, HBase, or MongoDB.
Knowledge of web services ecosystem, including: REST, SOAP, XML, JSON and HTTP(S)
Experience with messaging systems such as Kafka, Qpid or ActiveMQ preferable.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google, or Azure preferable.
Intuitive sense for spotting and investigating inconsistencies/anomalies in data. Unwavering standards for data quality and consistency.
Familiarity with Agile & XP practices, such as TDD, pair programming, continuous integration, and continuous delivery.
Accustomed to using with automated testing best practices (e.g. JUnit, Mockito)
Strong desire for highest quality code and craftsmanship.
Any minimal front-end dev experience (React, Angular, D3) considered a plus.
About Revinate
Revinate is a SaaS company that helps hotels know more about their guests so they can deliver personalized experiences that create valuable relationships and lifelong customers. Using guest data combined with our marketing engagement platform, hotels can better understand and engage their audiences, increasing loyalty and revenue. 30,000 of the world's leading hotels trust Revinate to help them reinvent the guest experience.
Headquartered in The Presidio of San Francisco with offices in Amsterdam and Singapore, Revinate is backed by leading investors Sozo Ventures, Benchmark Capital, Tenaya Capital, Formation 8, Northgate Capital, Tao Capital, GC Hotel Tech, and Industry Ventures.
Revinate values a challenging, fun and balanced culture that rewards innovation. We offer competitive salaries, stock options, great benefits, and thorough training and support. Recognized by Forbes as one of the top 10 Best Enterprise Software Startups To Work For in 2016, our commitment to people and culture speaks for itself.

title: Software Developer (m/w) mit Herzblut für Big Data
desc:
Job description
                    
Dabei können Sie uns unterstützen:
Sie übernehmen die fachliche und technische Beratung unserer Kunden hinsichtlich Big Data-Konzepten und Technologien und übernehmen optional die Rolle des Projektleiters oder Teilprojektleiters
Nach der Aufnahme und Analyse der Kundeanforderungen, entwerfen Sie passende, innovative und individuelle Hands-On-Entwicklungen von Softwarelösungen, Softwarearchitekturen und Frameworks auf Hadoop-Basis und migrieren existierende relationale Lösungen
Dabei unterstützen Sie oder sind verantwortlich für die technische Planung der Projekte, Steuerung der operativen Aufgaben sowie für die fachliche und technische Implementierung von Geschäfts-/Teillösungen und Services
Anschließend unterstützen Sie den Kunden beim Einsatz der Technologien und führen ggf. Schulungen bzw. Coachings für Projektmitarbeiter und Anwender durch
Bei Bedarf nehmen Sie an internen und externen Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen teil
Das bringen Sie mit:
Nach einem erfolgreichen Studium im Informatikumfeld, bringen Sie mehrjährige Erfahrung in den modernen Softwareentwicklungsmethoden wie z.B. Scrum oder Kanban mit und hegen rege Neugierde und Offenheit gegenüber Big Data Technologien
Dabei haben Sie die Anwendung wesentlicher Big Data Tools wie Hadoop, Spark, Storm, Flink, Elastic und/oder Data Science Algorithmen verinnerlicht
Zudem können Sie sehr sichere mathematische und statistische Kenntnisse vorweisen sowie explizites Know-how bei der Analyse von großen Datenmengen und der Anwendung von Algorithmen des maschinellen Lernens
Sie haben Kenntnisse im Bereich relationaler und NoSQL Datenbanken und Erfahrung im Einsatz gängiger Entwicklungsprozessmodelle
Wichtig sind Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Ein sicherer Umgang mit modernen Test-Verfahren ist für Sie genauso selbstverständlich wie die Kenntnis über verschiedene Präsentationstechniken
Loyales, kundenorientiertes und vorbildliches Verhalten, gute Präsentations-Skills, ein hoher Qualitätsanspruch sowie Reisebereitschaft bei Bedarf runden Ihr Profil ab
Was Sie erwartet:
Wir sind ein inhabergeführtes Familienunternehmen mit dynamischen Team, flachen Hierarchien, kurzen Kommunikationswegen, viel Raum für Eigeninitiative und hervorragenden Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Die Unternehmenskultur basiert auf Hilfsbereitschaft und Teamgeist, unterstützt durch Vertrauensarbeitszeit
Ein unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag, ein lukratives Bonusprogramm, Incentives (wie kostenlose Getränke, Sport- und Teamaktivitäten), sympathische Kollegen sowie die neuste Hardware und Technologien warten auf Sie!

title: WEYV Software Engineer
industry: Computer Software, Software Development / Engineering, Technology Consulting
desc:
Job description
                    
Come join the WEYV team to make visible difference in the digital content streaming space! WEYV is an entertainment app allowing you to easily listen, read, and watch content, as well as share with others. We are looking for a motivated, enthusiastic and flexible Software Engineer who can design and develop highly scalable, maintainable software solutions. This is an exciting opportunity to make a difference in the next generation of digital content streaming platform and applications.
As a WEYV Software Engineer, you will contribute to the design and development of our database that is cloud native.  Developing faster, more reliable processes is how you will measure success.  Your communication with other engineers will help find the most efficient solutions to complex problems.
Responsibilities:

Write and shepherd designs through the entire software development process, from requirements and use cases to shipping product (aka “write code”).

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
industry: Insurance, Location Based Services, Real Estate
desc:
Job description
                    
We are a fun and exciting web application and Big Data company. In order to meet an ever- increasing public demand, we are looking to hire a driven Quality Assurance Engineer to join our Ruby on Rails product development hosted on AWS. This is an exceptional opportunity to join our small, growing and profitable, venture-backed company.

This position will work from our offices in Worcester, MA. (Read further about our location, below!) Relocation assistance will be offered for the right out-of-area candidate.

What’s in it For You?
Help large and small businesses of all stripes make informed decisions by predicting future opportunities and risks at any location – crime, fires, investing futures, and more.
A casual, fun working environment, solving some of the most exhilarating Big Data problems in the industry, alongside a team that’s as passionate as you are about this stuff!
Competitive salary and great benefits (401(k), medical coverage, 5 weeks paid personal time each year)
Great work/life balance, with 40-45 hour work weeks the norm!
Long-term stability with a venture backed start up that is already profitable and growing
Investors include the Founders of MapQuest and CoreLogic
Responsibilities:
Create and maintain test plans for new and existing features.
Test browser based applications from UX/UI as well functional testing.
Ability to triage issues as they arise from customer support, management or your teammates.
Lead and Support efforts to automate testing.
Keep all departments updated on status of release and communicate obstacles and testing risks.
Contribute to the development and release of NeighborhoodScout and SecurityGauge
Support IT functions hosting services on AWS, continuous integration, test automation and manual testing.
Use modern infrastructure tools and platforms to automate our systems
Solve challenging problems working with massive datasets that include crime statistics, schools, predicting real estate values years into the future, predict fire and water damage, and more
Collaborate with PhD Geographers and Statisticians to deliver new, disruptive products
Requirements:
3+ years professional work experience
Proficient with Amazon Web Services (EC2, RDS, SQS, CloudFront), Route53, ELB
Tools: JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket, HipChat, Github, Chef, Puppet
Continuous integration, Version Control Systems (Semaphore, Jenkins), Test Automation
Experience or exposure to Agile/SCRUM is ideal
RSpec, Capabara, Selenium, Code coverage tools
Experience with API testing
Passion for breaking things!
Familiarity with the following is a strong plus:
MVC frameworks (Ruby on Rails, Symfony, Spring, Grails) a strong plus
HTML/JS frameworks (jQuery, Bootstrap, Foundation)
Frameworks: Ruby on Rails, Bootstrap, etc.
Jira for Bug Tracking and Reporting
Our Location:
Yards away from commuter rail hub, highway, pubs, restaurants and coffee shops.
5 miles in any direction and you are in quaint New England towns with nationally-ranked schools, historic charm, and great housing options (and we would know, we’re the experts!).
Interested?
Tell us about yourself and why you would like to work with us! Email careers at locationinc dot com and include a link to your website / portfolio / GitHub / LinkedIn.
Company Description
Location, Inc. is a small, high-end geospatial analysis Company born of university research, specializing in location-based decision-making tools: analytics, information and data. We license geospatial risk analytics and SaaS products for a host of business to business applications, and run NeighborhoodScout.com, the largest neighborhood search engine in the world, and _“the most trusted source for choosing a neighborhood,”_ according to *Money* ® *Magazine* .
Location, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Data Engineer, Data Warehouse
desc:
Job description
                    
The Data Engineering (DE) team is looking for a Data Warehouse engineer to help us architect, design and implement a scalable, reliable and automated Data Warehouse for the managing of all the data that drives our products. The ideal candidate will be comfortable going from the whiteboard design of a system all the way to the nuances of implementation.
This is an opportunity to join a growing company, and be a part of a team of folks accomplished in diverse engineering disciplines; focused on using the best of what lies at the forefront of technology and skills to address complex, real-world problems in the Healthcare and Life Science space. Some of the tools we use are: Python, Spark, AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, Postgres, Git, Airflow and Flask.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Design and develop state of the art data warehouses for the core data that drives our products.
Design and develop data models and schemas for our core data using big data technologies.
Work across multiple teams to automate and orchestrate the flow of data into our data warehouse.
Evaluate new technologies for continuous improvements in Data Engineering.
Produce high quality production ready code in an agile environment.
Collaborate closely with the product team to build new data features for our core product.
Work with the data scientists to implement data warehouse artifacts that would allow us to generate the data science .
Develop tools to monitor, debug and analyze the data pipeline.
Develop tools to automate, configure and operate our data pipelines.
Minimum
BS or MS in Computer Science or related degrees.
5+ years of relevant professional experience with demonstrated use of similar skills and technologies required.
2+ years of experience developing data warehouses using big data technologies like Hadoop, Redshift, Spark, AWS, etc.
Experience with...
Designing and implementing data warehouses using big data technologies.
Python, Scala or Java coding experience, proficiency with at least one of them is required.
Distributed systems for data processing tools such as Spark, Hadoop, Kubernetes, etc.
SQL and Relational Databases, like PostgreSQL.

You've been through the planning, launching and refactoring phases of data warehouses you have built.
A serious passion for data.
History of excellence and responsibility in previous engineering positions.
Ability to work as part of a collaborative team in a fast-paced environment.
Sincere interest in working at a startup and scaling with the company as we grow.

title: Assistant Professor, Tenure-Track Department of Computer Science
experience: Be one of the first applicants
desc:
Job description
                    
Assistant Professor, Tenure-Track Department of Computer Science

University of San Francisco

Job Summary:

The Department of Computer Science at the University of San Francisco is accepting applications for two tenure-track Assistant Professor positions starting in August 2018. This search seeks candidates from the field of Computer Science or a closely-related field.

The Department of Computer Science is a diverse and growing community with 10 full-time faculty members, over 200 undergraduate CS majors, and over 70 masters students. While we are growing, the CS department maintains small class sizes with 30 or fewer students, project-based learning, and a high degree of student-teacher interaction.

The department is highly collaborative both within and outside the department. In addition to an undergraduate CS major and a masters program in CS, the department also supports a new interdisciplinary undergraduate major in Data Science as well as a masters program in Analytics. Several faculty members are NSF funded and collaborate with industry in Silicon Valley and the San Francisco Bay Area.

The University of San Francisco is located in the heart of one of the world's most innovative and diverse cities, and is home to a vibrant academic community of students and faculty who achieve excellence in their fields. Its diverse student body enjoys direct access to faculty, small classes and outstanding opportunities in the city itself. USF is San Francisco's first university, and its Jesuit mission helps ignite a student's passion for social justice and a desire to “Change the World From Here.” For more information, visit http://www.usfca.edu. USF has been recognized as a top 20 entrepreneurial research university (Forbes 2015).

Job Responsibilities:

The successful candidates will be expected to teach both undergraduate and graduate courses, maintain an active research program that involves students, and perform service duties to the CS department and university. The standard teaching load for this position at USF is two 4-unit courses per semester with an additional third course every fourth semester (2-2-2-3 over two years).

Minimum Requirements:

Applicants must have a Ph.D. in Computer Science or a closely-related field completed prior to August 2018. Strong applicants from all CS sub-disciplines will be considered. Applicants must demonstrate both exceptional teaching ability and a strong potential for independent and collaborative research. In addition, an understanding of and commitment to support the mission of the University of San Francisco are required.

Additional Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

For information on how to apply, please visit the following link: http://apptrkr.com/1080160

EEO Policy
The University of San Francisco is an equal opportunity institution of higher education. As a matter of policy, the University does not discriminate in employment, educational services and academic programs on the basis of an individual’s race, color, religion, religious creed, ancestry, national origin, age (except minors), sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition (cancer-related and genetic-related) and disability, and the other bases prohibited by law. The University reasonably accommodates qualified individuals with disabilities under the law.

Copyright ©2017 Jobelephant.com Inc. All rights reserved.

https://www.jobelephant.com
