This role is ideally looking for someone coming from a development background who is able to provide remote support to our customers and who is passionate about customer service. 
The Technical Services Specialist I provides support for issues and the collection, validation and interpretation of data and statistics. They will also analyze and consolidate performance data and statistics. They will work with Customers to resolve issues in integrations and performance. The Technical Services Specialist I will support the customer activation and customer support groups to contribute to CardinalCommerce goals and initiatives.
Essential Functions: • Assist with Customer activations • Support, debug and troubleshoot existing applications and/or database issues. • Produce and maintain reports (mainly SQL/MS Excel) to support data and KPI requirements. • Analyze transactional data for reporting and troubleshooting • Analyze large quantities of data to find trends or patterns of potential issues • Work with software engineering on issues that cannot be resolved to identify a root cause problem. • Support, maintain and document software functionality • Design or develop automated testing tools • Off hours on-call availability when required.

title: Senior Data Engineer  Work with SnowFlake!
industry: B2B Sales, Cloud Services, Marketing Software
desc:
Job description
                    
HubSpot’s Data Engineering team sits within our Business Enablement function and is responsible for our central, enterprise data pipeline, data warehousing infrastructure, and business intelligence tooling. We aim to provide scalable, reliable systems that our data analysts and other developers can use easily and sustainably.
Data Engineering is a close partner to our Business Intelligence team, which is chartered with making HubSpot smarter through enabling an ever-deeper understanding of our customers.
We’re looking for a senior data engineer to help us build world class data pipelines and warehouses to be ready for the company’s next phase of growth and our BI program’s next chapter. This is a mission critical dependency for all of our strategic data initiatives. We want to help analysts and users access and get value from data while minimizing the impact of any operational or system issues.
As part of our Data Engineering team, you will have the opportunity to lead the effort on building a modern, sophisticated data pipeline with hyper fast and hyper reliable performance, auto-scaling resource management, low latency, quality assurance, and orchestrated transformations.
Here’s what we expect strong candidates to bring to the table:
Top decile skills and experience in the data domain. We aren’t overly concerned with specific technologies, though we expect top decile professionals to know the industry, how it’s evolving, best practices, and what tools are good fits for what jobs. We want somebody to spend their time ramping up on our use cases, not the tech.
A significant amount of experience in a Senior or Lead role where you’ve been the decision maker for major architectural decisions around the kinds of data pipelines we want to build.
Strong Java development experience of data ingestion systems and data pipelines
A desire, and level of comfort, in working on mission critical projects from start to finish.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills.
_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
HubSpot is the world’s leading inbound marketing and sales platform.  Over 18,000 customers in more than 90 countries use HubSpot’s software, services, and support to transform the way they attract, engage, and delight customers.
A global company with offices in Cambridge, MA, Portsmouth, NH, Dublin, Ireland, Sydney, Australia, Singapore, Tokyo, and soon to be Berlin, HubSpot transforms how organizations market and sell. Through its unique approach to company culture, HubSpot has also redefined how people work and live. Our commitment to autonomy, flexibility, and transparency prompted the creation of our Culture Code, which has gone viral, amassing more than 2M views. Ensuring that our customers and employees are continually growing and learning has helped make HubSpot a Best Place to Work in the eyes of Glassdoor, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc. The Boston Globe, and the Boston Business Journal. If you are looking for a place where you’ll tackle big problems alongside some of the most talented and dynamic people you’ve ever worked with, HubSpot might just be the place for you. Join us! #inboundjobs
_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

title: Software Engineer (Javascript, React, Python)
desc:
Job description
                    
Who we are
 At Broadway.com the result of your work will be seen and used by millions of people — tourists, theater lovers, students, groups, etc. Your creative and analytical efforts will play a role in their overall Broadway experience.
We believe in user-centered design principles. We employ the "don't make me think" user experience philosophy. We use our creativity to elevate the experience, and we test to validate our decisions to ensure the quality of the products we build.
From the technology side we use AWS, Django, ReactJS, Python, Swift, MySQL, Webpack, SASS…  among other things. Our team is passionate, professional, and all care deeply about our customer experience and the quality of the software that supports it.
We also go to conferences, offer plenty of learning resources, enjoy summer Fridays, and a handful of other fun things we hope to tell you about.
Who you are
You are a professional. You care about your work and how it affects others. You love to create.
You have excellent coding skills, commitment to web standards, and practice human-centered design principles.
You are an excellent communicator.
You are fluent with HTML/CSS/JS.
You know what BEM, OOCSS and SMACSS are, and why they are important.
You are very comfortable with Git or similar source control solutions.
You test your code across browsers, platforms, and devices.
You're able to work independently. While you're a manager-of-one, you also have experience working in a team environment.
You enjoy collaboration and the sharing of ideas and concepts.
You are able to quickly relay feedback from a design session or stakeholder meeting into a prototype, and continue to work with the team towards shipping the final design.
You have a passion for quality and an eye for detail. You obsess over the customer's experience and the usability of the product you are building.
What you'll do
If you were working for us, here are some of the things you may have done last week, among other things… 
Participated in product reviews with your team and stakeholders.
Deployed a new experience you’ve been working on that went through prototyping, and testing, but failed in a live a/b experiment… and learned from it.
Pitched a different implementation of a design deliverable you received by prototyping your concept.
Developed Javascript code that interfaces with an external API and handle the API response gracefully, creating an efficient and fluid customer experience.
Worked closely with a QA Analyst to review a bug in your code.
Reviewed how a new design fits into our existing UI library, worked towards reducing duplicate styles, removed extraneous elements, and kept your code lean and DRY.
Maintained the UI pattern library and updated existing, legacy code that doesn’t comply.
Worked within constraints of business requirements and timelines.
Created a git branch to work on a new feature.
Identified new opportunities to improve the customer experience.
Other front-end development related tasks as needed.
Tools We Use
Slack
Invision
Django
Javascript
ReactJS and Preact
Sass
Swift
Git
Jira
Amazon Web Services
MySQL
and many others…
To Apply
Include a link to any public code examples (websites, Github, etc) you may have.
Send a PDF of your resume to hire@broadway.com
* This is not a telecommute job. *                    
                "Skills & requirements
                        
Nice to haves
Experience working on a Django web project.
Experience working with e-commerce applications.
Experience with MVVM or MVC frameworks (ReactJS, Angular, Backbone, etc)

title: Software Engineer for Blockchain Services
desc:
Job description
                    
AlphaPoint is looking for a software engineer to join the team responsible for designing and developing our distributed-systems products and platforms, which power leading digital currency trading venues and permissioned blockchain solutions. Our software is built using C#, using custom messaging mechanisms over multiple transport protocols, with customized persistence and storage mechanisms, all optimized for high-volume enterprise-class real-time access-controlled transaction processing. In this position, you will work in every layer of the service tier (transports, messaging, framework, data persistence, business logic, …) and develop a rich understanding of both the system mechanisms and the application business domains.
As a key member of the software development and delivery team, you will:
Be part of a multi-disciplinary engineering team focused on delivering world-class industrial-strength distributed-systems software
Work with other developers, test engineers, analysts, and project managers to develop and deliver software products and solution implementations
Contribute to the evolution and enhancement of both our trading venue and blockchain platform product lines
Participate in solution development/delivery, using our products and platforms
Leverage Agile practices to incrementally and iteratively deliver high value
Analyze, design, code, and test software elements, with an eye for building functional, performant, scalable, solid production software in a timely manner
Prepare technical documentation and diagrams
Cultivate expertise in relevant aspects of target business domains and apply that knowledge to maximize technology value
Assist project and product leaders in making risk-managed planning and release decisions

                "Skills & requirements
                        
Proficiency in one or more OO languages (C#/.NET strongly preferred)
Familiarity with distributed systems patterns and techniques (SOA preferred)
Understanding of multithreading and concurrency
Experience with sockets, WebSockets, and/or message oriented middleware
Experience with serialization techniques like JSON, binary, or protobuf
Experience building, troubleshooting, and debugging distributed systems
Knowledge of code profiling, optimization, analysis tools
Familiarity with BDD/TDD and automated testing
Commitment to lean programming style and aversion to bloatware
Creative problem solver able to consider and propose multiple alternatives, taking into account technical and non-technical trade-offs and side effects
Some experience with trading or post-trading systems, payment systems, or financial processing systems is preferred
Knowledge of Bitcoin, cryptocurrencies, and/or blockchain technologies is a plus
Strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to collaborate with both technical and business staff
Ability to meet deadlines and work well under pressure in a fast-paced team environment
Passionate about technology and problem-solving
Desire to learn about complex financial business domains
3-5 years experience building distributed, transactional software solutions

title: Software Developer
desc:
Job description
                    
WDD is seeking a junior developer to join our team. The junior developer will work directly with a senior developer to bring client projects to completion, learning WDD’s agile, built-from-scratch methodology along the way. Upon project completion the junior developer will serve in a maintenance role, completing minor feature additions, enhancements, and bug fixes.
Our new developer has a passion for coding, is energized by complicated challenges, is a great communicator, and can adapt to an agile, sprint-focused work style. They're committed to delivering only the best software and technology solutions, have character and a sense of humor, and can work both individually and collaboratively.
The WDD team comprises some of the top developers in the area—we are picky and for good reason. Our culture is important to us and maintaining it with the right people is key.
This position is located in our Indianapolis, IN office. Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States without requirement of sponsorship/Visa. 
Essential Job Requirements
Time Management and Organization — Ability to manage your own time and juggle several projects at once
Collaborative — Communicate and work closely with software testers, project managers, and a senior developer to understand development priorities, goals, and timelines
Quick Learner — Adapt to the coding styles of other developers; quickly learns new tools and technologies
Skills & Requirements
Bachelor of Science Degree
Microsoft SQLServer
.NET Web API
C#
jQuery
Proven track record of designing scalable, distributed software applications
Object-oriented design experience

title: Senior Software Engineer
desc:
Job description
                    
Wayfair’s Storefront team creates the websites and apps where people shop and get inspired. They’re used by over two million people every day. As a senior engineer, you’ll own implementation of specific features. You’ll collaborate with product managers, designers, analysts, and testers to create great experiences for our customers.
Some Example Storefront Projects:
Augmented reality room planning
Early flushing and HTTP/2 support
Password-free login using an emailed link
Search for products that look like photos you take
What Your First Month Would Be Like:
Writing thoughtful and performant PHP code.
Mentoring other engineers.
Planning and running sprints.
What Your First Year Would Be Like:
Cowriting your team’s roadmap.
Impacting conversations about Storefront shared architecture.
Ensuring the resiliency of features through the high-traffic holiday season.
Why This Job Might Be For You:
You care about technology, but you don’t care about it for its own sake. You’re not married to specific tools. You’re comfortable moving up and down the stack to solve problems.
You care about your team. You learn together and you focus on the facts to drive decisions.
You care about the customer. You won’t be happy if you’re blindly executing on specs.
*** This position is ONLY for on-site in our Boston, MA headquarters***
Wayfair does not accept unsolicited candidate referrals or resumes / CVs from third-party vendors, including recruitment agencies. Wayfair will not be responsible or liable for any fees or costs associated with such unsolicited submissions.

title: Lead Data Engineer
experience: sql apache-kafka amazon-kinesis r apache-spark sysadmin
desc:
Job description
                    
Our mission is to create an exceptional user experience by matching our knowledge of customer needs with the latest technology in order to create a professional online representation of their brand and to guide our customers to success. On a worldwide scale, the opportunity for providing do-it-yourself websites is tremendous and Jimdo seeks to be the number one provider. Users from all over the world have already created more than 20 million websites using Jimdo - and we’re happy to see the numbers growing continuously!
We are a motivated team full of smart people. Everyone of us is an expert in what we do, and together we try to achieve the best possible results. Working in a young product company within a rapidly changing market comes with a lot of opportunities and many possibilities to contribute to our users’ success. To learn more about our story visit our website.
We are seeking a senior data engineer who will lead our team of ambitious data engineers and take our data warehouse to the next level to help make our users successful. If you are passionate about establishing a state of the art infrastructure and make our data warehouse fit for the future, then we're eager to get to know you.
You have the option to start immediately in our Hamburg office. This is a full-time, permanent position.
Responsibilities

Train and improve existing machine learning models, identify potential for future use cases and bring your ideas to life
Find opportunities to further improve the performance and stability of tools and infrastructure
Keep the data warehouse and all incoming and outgoing data streams running and up to date
Make sure all data is recoverable and secure
Build and improve internal software solutions to support the work of Data Analysts and other teams in their daily work
Define policies and contracts towards clean and unified incoming data
Requirements
Degree in Computer Science / Data Engineering or Backend Engineering or equivalent experience
At least 5 years of experience
Broad knowledge and experience in distributed systems (Kafka, Kinesis) and database architecture
Excellent skills in a variety of languages and tools (Python, Ruby, Java, R, SQL, scripting languages, APIs)
Experience in building and maintaining software components and infrastructure (AWS Stack, Jenkins, Spark)
Demonstrated ability to implement, handle and update disaster recovery procedures
Demonstrated ability to process complex information and dependencies in a continuously evolving environment
Abilities
Strong communication skills for finding simple and solid solutions
Positive attitude towards problem solving
Obsession with automation and simplicity
Ability to break complex problems down into manageable chunks
Drive to get things done
Solid spoken and written English communication skills

title: Director of Engineering, Core Systems
desc:
Job description
                    
What We're Looking For:



Engineering at 2U is fast paced, innovative, and full of people passionate about delivering on the promise of higher education via technology. We’re growing rapidly and are seeking collaborative and results-driven individuals to join us. In return, we can offer you a fun learning environment where your skills, experience and creativity will make a material impact on the company’s success and its overall mission. Your tenure at 2U will be a highlight of your career.
We strive for our teams to be cross-functional, self-organizing and autonomous. You will be working directly with product managers, business analysts, and your peers in a highly collaborative manner.
About The Role
We are looking for a thoughtful, collaborative and results-driven engineering leader with experience running teams of 5 to 10 engineers in an agile environment. You are a maker at heart and have experience in finding a balance between individual technical contribution and achieving results via your team. You are comfortable using and providing guidance in  techniques like test driven development (TDD), pair programming and retrospectives.
Above all, you care about delivering quality software in a sustainable and timely manner. You have experience in, and passion for, building and running effective teams that deliver and thrive.
Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To:






You are a competent maker, able to:
Make direct technical contributions (writing, debugging, reviewing and deploying code)
Provide technical guidance and feedback to your team members. 
Lead technical design of applications and participate in larger system design efforts
Advocate for end user needs in software you are building
You are a competent manager, able to own and direct your team in:
Planning and execution of short and medium term projects 
Hiring, engaging and developing for members of your team. Occasionally help with hiring on adjacent ones
Assessing, reporting, and improving systems and processes in your charge
Collaborating effectively with Product team (product managers, business analysts, and UX designers) to define and refine requirements
You have experience in (or clear potential for understanding) the higher education ecosystem, 2U’s 3 year strategy and major goals, and can align and execute your team’s deliverables accordingly.
This position reports to the Vice President, Engineering and is based in our NYC office.
Other Attributes That Will Help You in This Role:






The Core Systems team builds and maintains products that meet the needs of common patterns that underlie 2U's user-facing platform with the goal of sustainability, reliability, and reducing total cost of ownership. Many of the team's direct customers are other product managers and engineers at 2U, so transparency and balancing needs among many constituencies are of utmost importance.
We are looking for experience with the following:
Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Docker container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes or Mesos
Web frameworks like Tornado (Python), Phoenix (Elixir), or Hapi.js (Node.js)
Databases and key value stores like MySQL, MongoDB, or Redis
Distributed streaming platforms like Kafka or AWS Kinesis
Monitoring and alerting tools like Grafana and Sensu
EEO statement:2U is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against applicants or employees and ensures equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of their race, creed, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, national origin, age, marital status, disability, citizenship, military or veterans’ status, or any other classifications protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. 2U’s equal opportunity policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, job benefits, pay and dismissal.
Note: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by individuals assigned to this position, and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

title: Application Developer
industry: Agile Software Development, Enterprise Software, Mobile Development
desc:
Job description
                    
 We are looking for an Application Developer to ensure a full range of application interactive services are provided.  Originally formed as a technology incubator, BHiveLab has been growing steadily for the past two years, particularly in the areas of enterprise application development, cutting edge mobile and social technologies, SaaS platform development and even “Internet of Things” based solutions.  The goal of BHiveLab is to maintain the incubator aspect which keeps it on the forefront of technology, while capitalizing on its position as a “new breed” of digital technology provider that invents new ways to engage the on-the-go consumer through next-generation technology.
Primary Responsibilities:
Work with customers, Project Managers and Business Analysts to evaluate business requirements and processes to provide possible solutions and accurate estimates for development efforts, including development, automation, testing, and reporting.
Designs, develops, tests, implements and supports solutions and enhancements for systems and processes.
Generate, test, and document program code. Debug and resolve moderate to complex problems.
Assists in integration of, and communication between, purchased solutions.
Reviews team work products for quality and adherence to standards (peer code review).
Modify existing applications (or write new ones) of moderate to high complexity and scope, working with applications systems designs and specifications and utilizing standards, procedures, and techniques.
Operate in an environment that adheres to ITSM and Lean principles, Agile and Waterfall methodologies, as well as the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).
Independently perform problem determination and resolution in the production environment.
Coordinate testing and debugging for programming changes and assist subordinates with debugging, whenever necessary. 
May act as system expert, answering business questions and pursuing/following up with answers when they cannot be initially provided.
Responsible for problem resolution and correction of production/operational problems as assigned.
Stays up to date with IT technology issues, trends and developments and communicates back to management and departments both issues and opportunities, and assists in developing and improving procedures, standards, and best practices.
Prepare and update system documentation as required.
Mentors others in areas of expertise, including current technologies, systems, business practices, and standards.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively with business clients, IT management and staff
Ability to own deliverables from beginning to end with little direct supervision
Possess strong non-technical skills including, but not limited to, problem-solving, work prioritization, communication, self-direction, and time management.
Possess strong interpersonal skills (written/verbal communication, peer relationships, etc.) in order to represent BHiveLab positively in interactions (customer support, requirements gathering, etc.) throughout the enterprise and interact and communicate effectively with customers/internal clients in support of business objectives.  
Leverage time management, priority setting and problem solving skills in order to perform assigned tasks, with reasonable levels of self-direction.  Work well in both individual and group situations.
Required Skills:
Skilled at object oriented principles, application design, development methodologies, service oriented architecture
 Developing ASP.NET Web Applications in Visual Studio.NET 2012/2013 using the Microsoft.NET framework ( 4.0 and above), MVC Entity Framework, Microsoft SQL Server 20012/2014, XML, XSL, web services
Client-side technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX
Reporting Services (SRSS)
Writing and optimizing SQL Stored Procedures and Triggers
Required Experience:
Minimum of five years application development
Minimum of three years Enterprise Web Application Development
Preferred Experience:
Developing mobile applications or optimizing web sites for mobile/tablet displays
Legacy technology expertise
Building secure web applications
Systems Architecture and Design
Education:
4 yr. degree in Computer Science
ENVIRONMENTAL DEMANDS:Normal office environment. Ability to sit for extended periods of time including extensive use of PC equipment.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Search & Browse (Scala & Solr/ElasticSearch)
desc:
Job description
                    
THE OPPORTUNITYAs a software engineer in the area of "Search & Browse" you will focus on developing Zalando's in-house search engine service providing highly relevant personalized search results helping millions of people find their favorite fashion items. You will be working with state-of-the-art technology to build a SAAS component which can be fully leveraged within our Zalando platform. Your main challenges will include working with large amounts of data, deliver high-quality search results and also provide a high-performance, stable and auto-scaling production system. You will be part of a small, autonomous, and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced Scala developers and expert data scientists pushing "Fashion Search" one step further every day.WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
You have 3+ years of experience, working as a Scala Developer (or with any other functional programming language). A technical degree is a plus.
You are experienced with lucene-based technologies like Solr/ElasticSearch
You are keen on collaborating closely with Data Scientists & Data Analysts
A keen interest in applied Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing and Data Mining is essential, work experience in these topics a plus
You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to Enterprise level
You love to optimize processes & code and to use new technologies
You are experienced in building, evaluating, maintaining and improving large-scale, data-driven products
You have worked with current Big Data technology (e.g. Hadoop/MapReduce, Amazon EMR)
Knowing near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plus
Experience with Cloud Computing platforms such as AWS is a plus
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
You will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our search pipeline in short release cycles
You will implement highly-scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your team
You are ready to tweak and optimize our search for various markets all across Europe with more than a dozen different languages
You will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly-scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the job
You are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our search engine and other analytical customer experience solutions
You will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgrounds
Design, develop, deploy, operate & improve software solutions that impact millions of Zalando customers
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US
Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.
Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.
Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish work.
Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.
Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.
WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!

title: DevOps Engineer
desc:
Job description
                    
Do you want to Drive What’s Possible? Do you enjoy working in a collaborative and agile environment where your ideas can help shape the direction of a high volume digital experience? 
Do you want to work with a team of talented professionals that are keenly focused on solving complex business problems and supporting product innovation with technology?
Then your job search begins and ends here….

title: Software Engineer - C# - Mid to Senior Level
desc:
Job description
                    
Genscape is seeking a talented Software Developer to join our operations support team! The Software Developer will work with critical internal and external applications that help support and drive our Genscape Power/Oil/Gas/Ag/Bio Business. 
This individual will work with a small, dynamic team on the development of current and future applications encompassing a wide range of languages, tools and technologies.  You will have the freedom and autonomy to explore new ideas to optimize work flow and efficiencies.
What you will do and learn:
Create and maintain RESTful APIs using ASP.NET Web API.
Develop new web based tools in JavaScript/HTML5/JQuery/ AngularJS to improve work flow and efficiencies.
Enhance current legacy reporting and modeling applications incorporating coding best practices.
Work on the development of a new dashboard application using the latest browser technologies for building fast and responsive Uis.
Enhance an application that processes data on multiple databases, allowing easy access and visualization, using C#, ASP.MVC, JavaScript, JQuery.
Identify and pursue potential performance, reliability, and process improvements.
Help to improve/create data-processing and data-validation scripts among several applications along with including data visualization.
Over your first few months in this position, you will know you’re successful if:
You demonstrate a strong initiative to provide value in a highly collaborative team environment.
You demonstrate knowledge and carefulness essential to develop and manage business-critical 24-hour operational systems
In your first 30 Days you would know and understand 50% of the system administrator capabilities and be able to complete simple bug fixes/enhancements.
In your first 60 Days you would know and understand 100% of the diagnostic and critical characteristics of the system and be able to complete most if not all bug fixes/enhancements.
In your first 90 Days you are able to deliver your first production ready application and understand the full stack of technologies used.  

                "Skills & requirements
                        
This role might be for you if:
You have a Bachelors in Computer Science or related.
You have minimum 3 years software development experience
You have experience with C#, JavaScript, JQuery, SQL Server, Postgres, Oracle
You have a general understanding of Object Oriented programming concepts
You have exposure to HTML5, CSS
You have experience with development of Web-based applications 
You have worked with and IDE like IDEA, Visual Studio
You have used source control systems like Subversion, Git, etc.
You have a strong desire to learn new technologies fast! 
You like analyzing workflows and designing creative ways to improve them. 
You possess excellent analytical, written and oral communication skills
You like flexibility, are able to deal with ambiguity and like to work on multiple projects
You have an ability to work in a dispersed team environment
You have had some experience working in a Scrum/Agile environment
Once you land this position, you’ll get to enjoy:
A fun, fast paced, entrepreneurial environment where employees are viewed as the company’s greatest asset and critical to our success.
Being part of a team of extremely talented analysts, engineers, technologists and more.
A company that offers a strong focus on work life balance and encouragement to make a big impact where you work.
Excellent benefits and numerous perks!

title: RMBS Portfolio Specialist - Data Science
desc:
Job description
                    
This highly technical financial analyst position is responsible for customized investment research and portfolio management in the residential mortgage backed securities (RMBS) sector. The position is also responsible for developing quantitative models to assess diversifiable and idiosyncratic risks to forecast prepayment, default and loan modification related risks on residential loans.                    
                "Skills & requirements
                        
Minimum education required is a Master’s (or academic equivalent) in Business Administration, Finance, Financial Analytics, Economics, or other job-relevant major. 
Minimum experience required is at least five (5) years analyzing residential mortgage data and building quantitative and cash flow models using borrower-level information and macroeconomic factors.
Specifically, required is the demonstrated ability to: 
apply empirical methodologies and modeling techniques with risk and value decision authority in legacy RMBS, RMBS 2.0 and residential whole loan asset classes
analyze large scale loan level datasets using SAS, MATLAB, IntexCalc, Intex API, and C to develop and maintain cash flow models to evaluate credit risk transfer securities
re-underwrite non-performing loans by using borrower’s updated credit and property level information
perform residential loan “servicer” due diligence to rank capability to provide best RMBS sector servicing practices
track the home prices across different MSAs in US and maintain the model to forecast property values.

title: Backend Software Engineer - Haskell/Scala/Clojure
industry: Ad Tech, Advertising Technology, Computer Vision
desc:
Job description
                    
General Description Efficient and reliable ingestion of data from our panelists’ in-home devices is the foundation of TVision’s products. As a key member of the development team, you will be responsible for designing and implementing solutions that analyze and process large data streams and populate our columnar analytics databases in AWS. We are strong believers in statically typed functional languages. We are using Haskell as our primary backend programming language. You will be building product components for transforming and reducing raw data at scale, performing statistical analysis to develop appropriate data reductions, writing efficient analysis queries, and recommending improvements to our ingestion pipeline and database design. Primary Job Functions As a member of the backend development team, you will design and build:
The services that monitor our panelist devices, retrieve data from them, and keep them running and healthy
Algorithms that analyze and process multiple data points per second from thousands of devices
The compute infrastructure that runs those algorithms to get accurate, timely, reliable data delivery to our analysts and customers
The operational automation and monitoring that lets our team deliver all of that and go home on time!
Qualifications and Skills
BS/MS in Computer Science or closely related discipline
Knowledge of one or more functional programming languages (e.g. Haskell, Clojure or some LISP, Scala, ML). We are implementing our backend systems primarily in Haskell
Knowledge of the Python programming language is highly desirable
Experience with RDBMS.
Experience with Hadoop or Spark, while not necessary, will be a definite asset.
Familiarity with a cloud computing environment such as AWS. Devops experience, either with specific AWS technologies or with more general provisioning tools (Terraform, Chef, Docker), is a major plus.
0 - 5 years of industry experience
Communication and Culture
Strong communications skills with both technical and non-technical team members.
Collaborative and enthusiastic about agile development and scrum methodologies.
Strong sense of project ownership and personal responsibility.

                "Skills & requirements

title: Application Security Architect
desc:
Job description
                    
A Day in the Life of an Application Security Architect: 

The Application Security Architect secures enterprise information by determining security requirements, planning, implementing, testing security systems, preparing security standards, policies, and procedures.                    
                "Skills & requirements
                        
Assist software and network engineers, system and database administrators, and product managers with assessing security threats, identifying and tailoring security requirements and integrating security controls into the Product / Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Ensure the implementation of a secure build integration process; secure source code repositories practices and code escrow process
Ensure WAF protection and implementation are in place and responsible for maintaining rules, monitoring alerts and ensuring appropriate actions are taken
Determine security requirements by evaluating business strategies and requirements; researching information security standards; conducting system security and vulnerability analyses and risk assessments; studying architecture/platform; identifying integration issues; preparing cost estimates
Plans security systems by evaluating network and security technologies; developing requirements for local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), virtual private networks (VPNs), routers, firewalls, and related security and network devices; designs public key infrastructures (PKIs), including use of certification authorities (CAs) and digital signatures as well as hardware and software; adhering to industry standards
Verifies security systems by developing and implementing test scripts
Maintain security by monitoring and ensuring compliance to standards, policies, and procedures; conducting incident response analyses; developing and conducting training programs
Upgrade security systems by monitoring security environment; identifying security gaps; evaluating and implementing enhancements
Serves as the security architecture expert for the security functional areas across the organization and with 3rd-parties
Performs architecture risk analysis for existing systems, new acquisitions, identifies gaps and provides feedback for advancing enterprise security capabilities
Integrates security activities into projects or programs development lifecycle, ensures security activities are aligned with schedules and understands how to make win-win decisions between security and functionality
Lead the Security development effort to build secure applications to ensure key business and regulatory requirements are delivered.  Staying abreast of current and emerging technologies, and applying security best practices and technical expertise to create best-in-class Secure System Architecture
Drive secure application delivery through automated and manual application security testing
Implements security systems by specifying intrusion detection methodologies and equipment; directing equipment and software installation and calibration; preparing preventive and reactive measures; creating, transmitting, and maintaining keys; providing technical support; completing documentation
Leads or participates in setting the System Architectural strategy and defining the architecture roadmap
Leads or participates in the creation of application solution designs
Reviews work of other team members and mentor junior analysts as needed 

What you can bring to Meridian: 
Bachelor’s degree in area of specialty or related experience in the healthcare IT industry is required
Minimum of six years of experience in the following areas:
Application penetration testing
Architecting application solutions
Application security
Infrastructure security

Six+ years leading security architecture efforts that required close collaboration with project teams and business stakeholders
Familiar with architecture frameworks
Knowledge in IPS, DLP, Firewalls, SIEM, and security assessment tools/methodology (network, systems and application)
Must be able to remain calm in pressure situations and adapt quickly to change

title: Senior Software Engineer
industry: Ad Tech, Data & Analytics, Internet Marketing
desc:
Job description
                    
A big part of building successful companies is reaching the right audience. Here at Cogo Labs, we try to build reliable, scalable, and customizable tool chains that allow our businesses to find and attract users who will become loyal customers. We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to take ownership of key components of the core infrastructure that supports these marketing efforts. You'll work with other engineers and analysts alike, and you'll play a key role in incubating some of Boston's fastest growing startups.
As a Senior Software Engineer you will:
Build new systems to scale and enhance Cogo's email, display, and Facebook marketing capacities.
Maintain and improve existing libraries, APIs, and services that analyst teams rely on on a day-to-day basis.
Help analysts and other coworkers understand and better utilize the products you support.
Collaborate with our Compliance and BD teams to make sure that company best practices are implemented programmatically.
About Cogo Labs:
We’re a venture accelerator. We employ data-driven, analytical methodologies to build profitable web businesses.
Our work is challenging and dynamic; our environment is fun and supportive.
Our company is profitable and established. This means “startup culture” without “startup anxiety.”
We offer competitive salaries and benefits, plus an equity share that actually means something.
Our employees have lives outside of work. We are musicians, athletes, filmmakers, gamers, authors, and whatever you are.

                "Skills & requirements
                        
Things that would help you succeed in this role:
3+ years of professional programming experience.
BA/BS in Computer Science strongly preferred.
Fluency with at least two of the following languages: Go, Python, Lua, Java or C.
Expertise with MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Amazon Redshift.
Solid Linux systems administration skills.
Proven ability to build highly scalable systems.
Strong communication skills and a willingness to help others debug their code.
Good situational awareness and a sense for how to prioritize coding projects based on overall business goals.
Ability to thrive in an agile, team oriented environment.

title: Senior Software Developer - Classic Car Insurance
desc:
Job description
                    
Hagerty, the leading provider of classic car insurance, valuation tools and roadside service for people who love cars, is seeking a skilled and experienced Senior Software Developer. This individual will be responsible for taking a lead role in designing and building new functionality in an agile software development environment. This person will have opportunities to design and build web, mobile and desktop applications, web services, integration layers and many other types of complex software systems.   This role will be based in our Traverse City, MI or Ann Arbor, MI offices.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Lead cross-functional technical collaboration and actively promote code review, design review and paired programming practices
Coach and mentor junior technical staff and actively drive group decision making on technical matters
Effectively communicate technical details to product owners and leadership and break down complex stories and features into development tasks
Create, validate and review development standards and best practices
Provide technical project leadership on projects of all sizes and help drive positive technical and cultural changes across the organization
Troubleshoot and fix software bugs and aids in the testing of software
Collaborate with Test Engineers, Analysts, Agile Coaches and others to complete assignments
Participate in all phases of Agile SDLC (stand-ups, demos, retros, grooming, etc.)
REQUIREMENTS:
6 - 8 years of professional experience required
Expertise in C# and the .NET stack of technologies (MVC, WCF, Windows Forms, etc.) or equivalent enterprise development stack.
Strong working knowledge of data structures and algorithms as well as software design patterns and principles
Working knowledge of T-SQL and Microsoft SQL Server or equivalent
Hands-on experience working with integrated development environments, source code management systems and workflow management systems.
Working knowledge of enterprise architectural patterns and  technical road-mapping
Familiarity with Salesforce and the APEX programming language and digital platform concepts and development patterns
Working knowledge of front-end web languages and technologies (JavaScript, Angular, HTML, CSS, JSON, etc.)
Working knowledge of package management tools (NuGet, etc.) and automated testing tools (NUnit, etc.)
Experience working with Continuous Integration tools (Team City, etc.)
Hagerty has been named a Fortune Magazine Great Place to Work. Click the link to see our Great Rated! review.  http://reviews.greatplacetowork.com/hagerty
To apply for this position, please visit our career site at  www.hagerty.com/hagerty-corporate/careers EEO/AA

title: Sr Database Developer
desc:
Job description
                    
The Senior Database Developer is a key technical resource providing leadership and support on all stages of application and database development.  This position will be responsible for designing the conceptual, logical and physical data models necessary to support the analytic data requirements for various departmental reporting.  The Senior Database Developer should demonstrate expertise in a variety of the field’s concepts, practices and procedures.  This position will work closely with Data Warehouse Management and Analysts to gather and document requirements and complete the tasks presented to them.
Requirements:
Lead efforts in the development of new models, analytic processes and construction of Operational Database and Data Warehouse architectures
Coordinate and facilitate requirements, analysis, design and development of reports as directed by management.
Helps to define and maintain strict adherence to established development standards (SDLC).
Create and maintain documentation for all activities and processes
Improving and streamlining the processes regarding data flow and data quality to improve data accuracy, viability and value
Working as a business partner to provide decision support to various line of business leaders
Responsible for fully understanding business processes to ensure comfort in challenging data and information integrity coming from source systems
Communicate to business customers, technical teams and management in a consistent manner making complex technical issues and solutions clear, simple and understandable
Participate in the ongoing development and operations of a data warehouse and business intelligence architecture that enables fact-based decision support
Complete data-mining efforts as well as ad hoc analysis to ensure firm understanding of source system data and how it relates to business requirements and decision support for line of business partners
Demonstrate expertise in Database development, specifically SQL Server, techniques and best practices
Demonstrate a thorough understanding of Data Management philosophies and apply them to existing and to-be architectures
Possess overall understanding of IT architecture, infrastructure standards, database platforms and programming languages and tools
Ability to assist the Operational Database Administrator with maintenance, administrative tasks and problem-resolution when necessary
Designing and prototyping new analyses, reports, applications and systems
Skills & Requirements
Required:
7+ years of experience in databases / data warehouse environment
Strong SQL query, ETL and data architecture experience
Experience with DTS, SSIS or other ETL applications
Experience implementing new DW development projects
Ability and desire to mentor other team members
Experience working with large amounts of data, conducting analysis and presenting findings
Experience working in an agile SDM environment, and on project teams with varied technical disciplines represented
Exposure to dimensional modeling and ability to create extracts and loads from several disparate data sources
Dedicated to team building, establishes and maintains adherence to our Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).
Able to communicate effectively both verbally and non-verbally 
Preferred:
Mortgage and/or Financial Services industry experience
BS or BA degree in computer science or information technology
SQL Server 2012 Enterprise exposure
Experience developing within a Data Warehouse environment
SSAS exposure

title: Senior Full Stack .Net Web Application Developer
industry: Business Intelligence, Data & Analytics, Developer APIs
desc:
Job description
                    
What We Do
The team at MapLarge builds cutting edge products for data analytics and visualization to make the world safer, more productive, and more efficient for our millions of users and thousands of customers.  The Maplarge API provides real time geospatial analytics for billions of location events every day. Analysts using our geospatial visualization capability can instantly visualize and publish for data discovery and predictive model testing on any desktop, mobile or tablet device.
Who We Need
Cultural Fit - While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, there are three key traits we require of every team member that really define our team.
 Fun to Work With - Life is short and work should be fun.  
 Extremely Smart - We work on cutting edge hard problems and we need people who can both architect and code these systems at the same time while working with a highly intelligent peer group.  
Passionate Engineers - We need people who really love programming and exhibit the energy and creativity that comes from being fully engaged in what you do.
About the Role
This role is for full stack .Net web developers who enjoy working with WebService API's in C# on the server side and creating sophisticated single page applications in TypeScript and JavaScript on the client side. In this role you will be helping to design and build the server and client side API's for MapLarge components that we combine into new interactive dashboards.    This job is for advanced programmers only and you do not have to have any design, css or other artistic skills.   Please be ready to tell us about any experience you have working with complex single page applications, designing C# web service API's and building reusable components with JavaScript or TypeScript.
Requirements:
US Person based anywhere in the US (100% remote allowed but no off shore)
5 Years work experience as a programmer
Highly Comfortable with Typescript, C# and Visual Studio
Very Experienced with Web Development & JavaScript

title: Data Scientist
desc:
Job description
                    
Today, we are looking for a Data Scientist to join our talented team. You will work with our Data Engineering team to validate and mine large datasets, as well as build predictive models and machine learning systems.
You have a strong quantitative background in academia, or industry, and  thrive when working on large projects independently and as a member of a lean, accomplished team.
What will you do?
You have the ability to clean, analyze, and mine data to unearth trends
You also have the technical chops to build a system around this data that improves the POF experience - deploying production code
You can develop data pipelines with automated, machine-learning systems that convert large source datasets into actionable signals
You like deep-diving into unstructured data and building complex models to extract valuable insights into our users and our business
You can perform time series analysis and forecasting for a variety of important business and operational metrics
You make business recommendations (e.g. cost-benefit, trend forecasting, experiment analysis) with effective presentations of quantitative findings to multiple levels of stakeholders
You craft new algorithms and learning systems to detect and combat spam and fraud
You have experience coordinating with business analysts to define analytic events and key performance metrics
You have experience writing complex algorithms and measuring their impact on a user base
You have the ability to see the “big picture” and how your work relates to POF’s entire business - and the ability to prioritize your work accordingly
What does our ideal candidate look like?
M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related field. Advanced degrees preferred, but not required
Math degree for stats
Industry experience as a Data Scientist / Data Engineer / Machine-Learning Engineer or demonstrated ability to drive value through data science projects
Deep understanding of fundamental statistics: inference, Bayesian methods, likelihood estimation, decision theory, Monte-Carlo methods and sampling theory
Knowledge of experiment design and hypothesis testing
Knowledgeable in data cleaning, data mining and distributed machine learning
Ability to rapidly acquire and adopt new knowledge and techniques
Proficient with standard SQL and relational databases; experience with Apache Spark & HDFS a plus
Familiarity with R or Python and their data science/machine learning packages - Need java
Comfortable working independently on large projects (demonstrated via industry or academic experience) or as part of a diverse team of different skills as necessary

title: Lead Developer - FinTech
desc:
Job description
                    
As a Dev Lead at FRT, you will use your leadership and engineering skills to ensure delivery of process automation tools and solve challenging technical problems:
Lead a team of engineers to efficient and effective software delivery
Working closely with product owners, business analysts, techops, developers, and other stakeholders, plan, coordinate, and lead activities across the delivery lifecycle
Offer support and guidance to support and assist development at the code level, while still making significant hands-on contributions
Ensure code produced by all developers meets standards and adheres to internal guidelines and frameworks

Automate our existing lines of business and deliver new product lines
Transition our legacy application to a fully-distributed application running across two data centers (active/active), applying microservice architecture
Build automated workflow for internal users within and across our operations, data analytics, and finance teams
Integrate two client-facing portals

Solve challenging technical problems – recent challenges include:
Coercing browsers to communicate with loosely coupled, distributed, message-driven systems by interjecting bridging layers into the communication channel, effectively pipelining Kafka to Socket.io;
Deploying microservice architecture to distribute computational resources across multiple data centers and leverage them as a means to re-architect away from a centralized Oracle database, by black boxing persistence, to a federated data system with best-tool-for-the-job persistence choices (Mongo, Redis, and Oracle)
Utilizing the “super parts” of JavaScript to build applications (Angular and NodeJs) in a point free functional style, leveraging Ramda, Folktale, and Point Free Fantasy where appropriate
Building a Micro Service registry and discovery system to allow for the elastic deployment and consumption of services, delivering dynamically built proxy objects to the client, leveraging Zookeeper (and Exhibitor) as an internal repository


                "Skills & requirements
                        
An experienced full-stack engineer who loves GUIs as much as algorithms and has experience using at least some of our tech stack (presently, AngularJs, NodeJs, Mongo, ES6, Oracle, Pentaho);
An unabashed geek with an interest in functional programming, distributed systems, and persistence strategies;
A patient and steadfast leader who is thought of as the calm in any storm;
Committed to learning, applying, and supporting the technologies that can best solve the issue faced;
A world class engineer and problem solver who also has phenomenal communication and collaboration skills;
An intellectually curious person with a demonstrated commitment to continuous growth and improvement; and
Of course, a desire to join a growing company with a vibrant, entrepreneurial culture, dedicated to being the top provider in the class action recovery space.

title: Senior FE Developer - Machine Learning and AI Cyber Security Company
desc:
Job description
                    
As a member of the multi-tenant console team you will design, implement and maintain a high distributed cloud application aimed at orchestration of tasks across massive # of customers. We favor individuals who enjoy collaborating with a variety of colleagues across the company including business stakeholders, senior leadership, architects, back-end engineers and front-end developers.
What you will do
Collaborate with peers on design, estimation and implementation of all things front-end. (React)
Work closely with architecture team to build optimal content delivery strategy to optimize customer experiences
Perform peer review of source code to monitor for best practices, level of effort, and documentation
Work with key business stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical requirements
Collaborate with backend team to build RESTful APIs for front-end integration.
Solve difficult problems while continuously learning and improving
Version control with git
What we are looking for
4 year college degree in computer science or equivalent industry experience
Excellent written and verbal communication
Ability to learn quickly: Willingness to learn, and adapt to new technologies and contribute in a productive environment.
Understanding of common design patterns and object oriented principles
Understanding of content delivery network's role in edge caching and end user performance experience
Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (Angular, React)
Experience with component-based front end UI libraries (Bootstrap, Zurb, Semantic)
Experience in a linux environment or generally not afraid of the terminal interface
Desire to work in a fast-paced, start-up environment solving challenging problems
Enjoys keeping abreast of the latest web technology threns while embracing the significance of supporting
A strong work ethic, sense of humor (even bad humor) and collaborative mindset
Demonstrated knowledge of stateless session concepts and JOSE
Understanding Pros/Cons of client side caching and edge caching
Above and beyond
A Github account with a great project or recent open source project contributions
Experience with Continuous Integration preferred (Jenkins, TravisCI, Bamboo, etc.)

title: Interactive Developer
industry: Creative Services, Integrated Marketing Solutions, Product Development
desc:
Job description
                    
GS&F is looking for an mid-level Interactive Developer to join our growing Interactive Development team. You will be responsible for working alongside agency Project Managers and Interactive Developers to implement web and mobile solutions that meet client needs and agency standards. Additionally, you'll participate in daily SCRUMs, weekly sprint planning, and peer code reviews. You should be comfortable working in a creative, fast-pasted and collaborative environment and exemplify a service-oriented mentality. This is a “full-stack” development opportunity, and is ideal for the mid-level developer seeking a career path in preparation for senior level responsibilities.
Skills & Requirements
2-3 years of experience working within a development team implementing, launching and maintaining professional websites across a variety of platforms; prior agency experience preferred
Bachelor’s degree or certification in Computer Science or related field; significant work experience and professional portfolio/repo would be considered
Understanding of Agile methodologies and ability to work alongside Business Analysts and Project Managers to plan and move tickets through the software development life-cycle
Fluent in HTML, CSS, and Javascript, with previous experience in React, node.js, along with troubleshooting cross-browser compatibility issues according to web standards
Working knowledge of *SQL, technical fundamentals of the Internet, and source code management tools and processes
Previous experience using WordPress or similar website CMS a plus
Comfortable being held accountable for delivering projects on time and to the highest standard
Highly accountable to your colleagues and exhibits a “take ownership” mentality
Extremely detail-oriented and organized
